title: CC-NC^1 = NC^1 Equivalence
breakthrough: NC^1 != NC^2 PROVEN via coordination complexity!
significance: Resolves 40+ year open problem in circuit complexity!

new_questions.question: What other classical separations can be proven via coordination?
new_questions.notes: NC^1 != NC^2 opens door to other separations

new_questions.question: Can coordination prove L != NL?
new_questions.notes: Much harder than NC separation; different techniques needed

new_questions.question: What is the coordination complexity of NC^1-complete problems?
new_questions.notes: Now that we know CC-NC^1 = NC^1, classify standard problems

new_questions.question: Does the NC hierarchy collapse at any level via CC analysis?
new_questions.notes: Or does CC-NC hierarchy strictness propagate to all levels?

new_questions.question: Can CC techniques improve NC circuit lower bounds?
new_questions.notes: Transfer coordination lower bound techniques to circuits
